choices.D: All tablespaces in the database must be locally managed.
choices.C: Redo log groups must have at least two members each.
choices.A: An RMAN channel must be configured to device-type disk.
choices.B: The database must be configured in ARCHIVELOG mode.

questions.question_text:
Your database supports an online transaction processing (OLTP) workload and it needs to be up 24 x 7. You want to perform a complete database backup by using RMAN.
Identify the minimum requirement for accomplishing the task.

You are administering a multitenant container database (CDB) CDB1 with two pluggable databases (PDBs), PDB1 and PDB2. You execute the following commands on CBD$ROOT as the SYS user:
SQL> CREATE USER c##scott IDENTIFIED BY scottorcll;
SQL> GRANT CREATE SESSION TO c##scott user?
Which statement is true about the c##scott user?

choices.A: It is created in all the PDBs with the CREATE SESSION privilege.
choices.C: It is created and has the CREATE SESSION privilege only in a PDB that is open.
choices.D: It is created only in CDB$ROOT and has the CREATE SESSION privilege.
choices.B: It is created in all the PDBs but has the CREATE SESSION privilege only in CDB$ROOT.

discussion.content: its B and i tested this

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about roles in multitenant container databases (CDBs)?

choices.E: The root container can have both local and common roles.
choices.D: A common role can be granted only system privileges.
choices.F: A local role can be assigned to a common role in a PDB.
choices.C: A common user can create a local role by default in any pluggable database (PDB) that is plugged in to a CDB.
choices.B: A common role can be granted only to a common user.
choices.A: Local roles can be granted to local and common users.

comments.content: VPC owner can be a recovery catalog owner,the recommend answer is correct

discussion.content: The recovery_catalog_owner role should be granted to the virtual catalog owner.

questions.question_text: Which three conditions must be met before you Virtual Private Catalog (VPC) can be created and used by an Administrator?

choices.E: The DBA role must be granted to the virtual catalog owner.
choices.D: The REGISTER DATABASE privilege should be granted to the virtual catalog owner.
choices.B: The owner of the VPC cannot own recovery catalog.
choices.A: A base recovery catalog must exist.
choices.C: At least one target database should be registered in the recovery catalog.

questions.question_text:
Your database is running in ARCHIVELOG mode. Complete database backups are performed daily at midnight. A user accidentally truncates an important table at
10 AM after the last backup. After that, a few important transactions are performed on the database.
Which two best methods for recovering the truncated table data?

discussion.content: why not AE,notice 'After that, a few important transactions are performed on the database'...
D/E Falseï¼Œtruncate is an DDL phase,it means they couldn't be flashback,B is correct ,but A&C seems better

comments.content: i agree A C. a truncated table cannot be recovered by Flashback feature
